vulnerability_findings.name: unnecessary-checked-arithmetic-in-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: A lot of times there is no risk that the loop counter can overflow. Using Solidity's unchecked block saves the overflow checks.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(_from == msg.sender || operatorApproval[_from][msg.sender] == true, "Need operator approval for 3rd party transfers.");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(_to != address(0x0), "destination address must be non-zero.");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(_from == msg.sender || operatorApproval[_from][msg.sender] == true, "Need operator approval for 3rd party transfers.");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(_to != address(0x0), "destination address must be non-zero.");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(_ids.length == _values.length, "_ids and _values array length must match.");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: constant-function
vulnerability_findings.message: Address.isContract (CurioERC1155Wrapper.sol#73-84) is declared view but contains assembly code

vulnerability_findings.name: erc20-interface
vulnerability_findings.message:
ICurio (CurioERC1155Wrapper.sol#492-498) has incorrect ERC20 function interface(s):
	-transferFrom (CurioERC1155Wrapper.sol#495)
	-transfer (CurioERC1155Wrapper.sol#496)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-benign
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in AbstractWrapper.wrap (CurioERC1155Wrapper.sol#609-629):
	External calls:
	- require(bool,string)(curio.balanceOf(msg.sender) >= _quantity,insufficient curio balance) (CurioERC1155Wrapper.sol#615)
	- require(bool,string)(curio.allowance(msg.sender,address(this)) >= _quantity,insufficient curio allowance) (CurioERC1155Wrapper.sol#616)
	- curio.transferFrom(msg.sender,address(this),_quantity) (CurioERC1155Wrapper.sol#618)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- balances (CurioERC1155Wrapper.sol#620)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-benign
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in AbstractWrapper.wrapBatch (CurioERC1155Wrapper.sol#634-662):
	External calls:
	- require(bool,string)(curio.balanceOf(msg.sender) >= _quantity,insufficient curio balance) (CurioERC1155Wrapper.sol#647)
	- require(bool,string)(curio.allowance(msg.sender,address(this)) >= _quantity,insufficient curio allowance) (CurioERC1155Wrapper.sol#648)
	- curio.transferFrom(msg.sender,address(this),_quantity) (CurioERC1155Wrapper.sol#650)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- balances (CurioERC1155Wrapper.sol#652)

vulnerability_findings.name: assembly
vulnerability_findings.message:
Address.isContract uses assembly (CurioERC1155Wrapper.sol#73-84)
	- CurioERC1155Wrapper.sol#82

errors: exception (RuntimeError: Source map error, unknown name(SHR) or instr_name(INVALID))

vulnerability_findings.name: Exception State (SWC 110)
vulnerability_findings.message:
An assertion violation was triggered.
It is possible to trigger an assertion violation. Note that Solidity assert() statements should only be used to check invariants. Review the transaction trace generated for this issue and either make sure your program logic is correct, or use require() instead of assert() if your goal is to constrain user inputs or enforce preconditions. Remember to validate inputs from both callers (for instance, via passed arguments) and callees (for instance, via return values).
Classification: SWC-110
